snippet: Survivors said the captain made “wrong maneuvers” and collided with a rescue ship, precipitating a capsize that the authorities say killed more than 800.
abstract: Italian authorities arrest Mohammed Ali Malek, captain of migrant ship that capsized off coast of Libya killing more than 800 people, on suspicion of multiple homicide; few survivors say he made 'wrong manuevers' and collided with rescue ship, causing tragedy.

byline.original: By JIM YARDLEY and DAN BILEFSKY
byline.contributor: Jim Yardley reported from Mineo, and Dan Bilefsky from London. Gaia Pianigiani contributed reporting from Mineo, and Nick Cumming-Bruce from Geneva.

lead_paragraph: Survivors said the captain made “wrong maneuvers” and collided with a rescue ship, precipitating a capsize that the authorities say killed more than 800.

headline.main: Migrant Boat Captain Steered Toward Tragedy in Mediterranean, Authorities Say
headline.print_headline: Survivors Say Captain Steered Into Tragedy

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
